title: Why do I hate music nowadays? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because you’re unique and smart. Music nowadays follows such a repetitive nature today, they all sound the same. The talent in the industry has dropped immensely, no longer is a song produced from the heart and soul, it’s produced from a computer. Music today is basically only meant for dancing, the only way to be successful is to make music that you can dance to. It’s no longer a progressive art, it’s an art of who can make the most money from the most catchiest song.

Because it's no longer music. It's micro-chipped video games with people as props. Check YT for video of now-famous “singers” without Auto Tune, then listen to Rosemary Clooney, Johnny Mathis, Tony Bennett, k.d lang. Hear the difference?
